forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Light Rain Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 52 overnight. West southwest wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night settles over Downtown San Francisco, the city drapes itself in a cloak of clouds, hinting at a wet dawn ahead. The air carries a hint of electricity—a tangible anticipation of the rain expected to arrive after four, ushering in a modest chill. Temperatures linger around a cool 50, nudging gently upward as the hours pass, while a gentle wind whispers from the west-southwest.

Looking towards tomorrow, expect a parade of precipitation, giving way eventually to patches of sun breaking through the gray. The high will flirt with 57, but as the rain wanes, the temperature will gradually fall again to a cooler 53. With the robust likelihood of rain reaching 90%, one would do well to keep a sturdy umbrella close, perhaps donning a water-resistant coat to keep the dampness at bay. For evening activities, a quiet stroll through the local art galleries or a snug evening spent in a cozy café could prove delightful—embracing the rhythm of a city that dances with the rain.
